Version

This is version 2 of the file.

Purpose

Shared_ptr class header.

Author

Daniel “q66” Kolesa quak.nosp@m.er66@gmai.nosp@m.l.com

Originally inspired by implementation from ecaprice library (http://github.com/graphitemaster/ecaprice) by Dale “graphitemaster” Weiler, currently completely custom implementation.

License

This file is licensed under MIT.  See COPYING.txt for more information.

types

namespace types

Shared_Ptr

template<typename T> struct Shared_Ptr

A shared pointer.  Basically a reference counted container.  Useful for i.e. storing pointers in various container types like vectors and hashtables without risking leaks.

Functions

Shared_Ptr

Shared_Ptr(): p_ptr(NULL), p_count(NULL)

Initializes empty Shared_Ptr.

Shared_Ptr

Shared_Ptr(const Shared_Ptr<T> &p): p_ptr(p.p_ptr), p_count(p.p_count)

Initializes Shared_Ptr from Shared_Ptr.  Increments the counter.

Shared_Ptr

Shared_Ptr(T *p): p_ptr(p), p_count(NULL)

Initializes Shared_Ptr from a pointer.

Shared_Ptr

~Shared_Ptr()

Decrements the counter.  If it reaches 0, both pointer and counter will be freed.

=

Shared_Ptr<T>& operator=(const Shared_Ptr<T> &p)

Assigns the Shared_Ptr from another one.  Inherits its reference count and increments it by one.

get

T *get()

Returns the raw pointer.

get

const T *get() const

Returns a const version of the raw pointer.

->

T *operator->()

Overload of this operator so you can manipulate with the container simillarily to a standard pointer.

*

T& operator*()

Overload of this operator so you can manipulate with the container simillarily to a standard pointer.

->

const T *operator->() const

Overload of this operator so you can manipulate with the container simillarily to a standard pointer.  Const version.

*

const T& operator*() const

Overload of this operator so you can manipulate with the container simillarily to a standard pointer.  Const version.

!=

bool operator!=(const Shared_Ptr<T> &p) const

<=

bool operator<=(const Shared_Ptr<T>& p) const

>=

bool operator>=(const Shared_Ptr<T> &p) const
